result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery D. Lyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery D. Lyman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Zachery D. Lyman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation on record by Ms. Tlusty. Advised of right to counsel.  Waived at these proceedings.   DE entered a plea of guilty to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and entered judgment of conviction.  Court withheld sentence on Count 1 and placed DE on probation for one year with the following conditions: Court costs; AODA and comply with treatment recommendations; DNA sample and surcharge; Any other counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court dismisses and reads in Ct. 2.  ba
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Zachery D. Lyman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives the reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty to the charges on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Next court date is a pretrial conference on February 26, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
